column5: i have a canadian non resident license. might be taking my kids into canadian waters of lake erie. They are 14. anyone know the minimum age required to have a license? thanks!

[font color=green size=3][b] Non-residents 18 years of age and older must purchase a licence. Non-residents under 18 years of age may fish without a licence if accomanied by an adult who has a valid Ontario fishing licence. Any fish caught are part of the adults catch and possesion limit. Non-residents under 18 yrs. may purchase a licence and any fish they catch applies to the limits of that licence. Wish'in I was fish'in on Wabby
hey THANKS! just what i needed!
What if you are nonresident with your 16 year old and also a 10 year old? Is my license enough? We are C+R only so limits don't matter. eric
